intro: Clastopus bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored lousewort, is a small flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its distinctive two-toned flowers, which are typically pink and white. The plant grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in open woods or along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and erect. Clastopus bicolor is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants.
